DataElement.preferredName: Patient Percutaneous Needle Biopsy Or Excisional Biopsy Amenable Neoplasm Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator response regarding whether a patient meets the eligibility criteria for percutaneous needle biopsy or excisional biopsy amenable tumor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Percutaneous Needle Biopsy Or Excisional Biopsy Amenable Neoplasm Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:A needle biopsy that is done through the skin._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A surgical procedure in which an entire lesion is removed for microscopic examination._Having the appropriate qualities._A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Percutaneous Needle Biopsy Or Excisional Biopsy Amenable Neoplasm Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: No Value Exists:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A surgical procedure in which an entire lesion is removed for microscopic examination.:Having the appropriate qualities.:A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A needle biopsy that is done through the skin.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A surgical procedure in which an entire lesion is removed for microscopic examination.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have tumor amena
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have tumor amenable to percutaneous or excisional skin biopsy and is willing to undergo a tumor biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have tumor amenable to percutaneous or excisional skin biopsy and is willing to undergo a tumor biopsy OR biopsy samples (FFPE blocks) collected on another study or procedure within 6 months prior to registration on MPACT are available and patient has not received any investigational or targeted treatment since that time?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have tumor amenable to percutaneous or excisional skin biopsy and is willing to undergo a tumor biopsy OR biopsy samples (FFPE blocks) collected on another study or procedure within 6 months prior to registration on MPACT are available and patient has not received any investigational or targeted treatment since that time OR a report from a MATCH study designated CLIA laboratory that a patient has a variant in the genes of interest?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a lesion or lesions amenable to biopsy and is willing to undergo 3 core needle biopsy procedures for research purposes?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled to the expansion cohort, is patient willing to undergo two core biopsy procedures and have a lesion amendable to biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: For Phase 2 only: Does patient have at least one tumor lesion amendable to biopsy?
